name: Hammer

Method.doc:
Binds hotkeys for WindowScreenLeftAndRight

Parameters:
 * mapping - A table containing hotkey objifier/key details for the following items:
  * screen_left, screen_right - move the window to the left/right screen (if you have more than one monitor connected, does nothing otherwise)
Method.name: bindHotkeys
parameters: * mapping - A table containing hotkey objifier/key details for the following items:
* screen_left, screen_right - move the window to the left/right screen (if you have more than one monitor connected, does nothing otherwise)

Variable.desc: Table containing a sample set of hotkeys that can be
Variable.doc:
Table containing a sample set of hotkeys that can be
assigned to the different operations. These are not bound
by default - if you want to use them you have to call:
`spoon.WindowScreenLeftAndRight:bindHotkeys(spoon.WindowScreenLeftAndRight.defaultHotkeys)`
after loading the spoon. Value:
```
 {
    screen_left = { {"ctrl", "alt", "cmd"}, "Left" },
    screen_right= { {"ctrl", "alt", "cmd"}, "Right" },
 }
```
Variable.name: defaultHotkeys
Variable.stripped_doc:
assigned to the different operations. These are not bound
by default - if you want to use them you have to call:
`spoon.WindowScreenLeftAndRight:bindHotkeys(spoon.WindowScreenLeftAndRight.defaultHotkeys)`
after loading the spoon. Value:
```
 {
    screen_left = { {"ctrl", "alt", "cmd"}, "Left" },
    screen_right= { {"ctrl", "alt", "cmd"}, "Right" },
 }
```

Variable.desc: Logger object used within the Spoon. Can be accessed to set the default log level for the messages coming from the Spoon.
Variable.doc: Logger object used within the Spoon. Can be accessed to set the default log level for the messages coming from the Spoon.
Variable.name: logger
